results.title: First aid action
results.brief_description: Concentrates upon basic first aid steps. Simulated situations provide an opportunity to discuss and demonstrate mouth-to-mouth resuscitation, shock, bleeding, burns, fractures, poisoning and sudden illness. A recap is made of all first aid directions. Shots of real accidents provide realism which reinforce the film’s theme. Narrated by Burt Reynolds.

results.title: Fire vs fire
results.brief_description: A fire control training film, based on a conference held to discuss burning out and backfiring as techniques of controlling forest fires. The indirect attack is backfiring (backburning) toward the main fire from a distance. Burning out necessitates working in close and burning toward the fire.

results.title: Fire safety
results.brief_description: Comedian Ross Williams gives a light hearted, but informative overview of what to do in different sorts of fires such as; kitchen fires, car fires, house fires, bush fires, and campfires. The programme also looks at effective use of appropriate fire extinguishers, the importance of smoke detectors and evacuataion plans, and general safety with household items. Produced with the assistance of Avalon Airport Rescue and Fire Fighting Services, NSW Mines Rescue Service and Tasmanian Fire Service.

results.title: Fips the trouble maker
results.brief_description: Puppet film for children and without commentary. Tells the story of the irrepressible trouble-maker Fips, a mischievous toy maker. He interrupts the elephant and bear and two dolls who are reading a story, knocks their toys over, and is sat in the corner, until one relents and lets him have a bowl whereupon he knocks down all the pins first go!

results.title: Finland designs for living
results.brief_description: This film presents the beauty and variety of modern design on Finland. Shows designers at work at their drawing boards and in their studios creating by hand, what is later mass produced in the factory. Includes steel saucepans and cutlery, colorful weaving, the creation of pottery, its earliest stage as clay turning on a hand-wheel and beautiful glass being blown by skilled craftsmen working closely with the designer of the product.

results.title: Finding the way home
results.creator_credit: Julie McDonald and Children's Welfare Association of Victoria
results.brief_description: Foster parents in rural Victoria discuss what it’s like to care for a foster child, covering issues such as selecting a child, financial implications, emotional support, and most importantly, the benefits. Families interviewed include a single mother with children, an older childless couple, and a middle aged couple with their own children. A young man whose lived with a foster family also shares his experience. Worthwhile viewing for anyone considering fostering a child. Supported by the Federal Department of Family and Community Services.
